revised_title: Fossil Remains of the Rhinoceros in a Cavern at Plymouth
tldr: This article describes the discovery of fossil remains of a rhinoceros found in a limestone cavern at Plymouth. The bones were in a perfect state of preservation and belonged to three different animals. The author compares the size of the fossil metacarpal bone to that of a known rhinoceros skeleton and discusses the chemical composition of the bones. The discovery highlights the geological and paleontological significance of the site.
